pullRequest.body:
---

I'm not absolutely convinced about the proposed new file `FiniteSpan.lean`. According to `#find_home` (run using `import Mathlib`) the lemma `LinearEquiv.isOfFinOrder_of_finite_of_span_eq_top_of_image_subset` must go either in a new file or in one of the following:
```
 Mathlib.Analysis.Convex.Between,
 Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.AffineSpace.MidpointZero,
 Mathlib.RepresentationTheory.Maschke,
 Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Alternating.Basic,
 Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Reflection,
 Mathlib.Algebra.CharP.Quotient,
 Mathlib.GroupTheory.Perm.Cycle.Type,
 Mathlib.Algebra.CharP.Reduced,
 Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPolynomial.Basic,
 Mathlib.Data.Matrix.CharP,
 Mathlib.Data.ZMod.Basic,
 Mathlib.ModelTheory.Algebra.Field.CharP,
 Mathlib.RingTheory.Polynomial.Basic,
 Mathlib.Algebra.CharP.Algebra,
 Mathlib.Data.Complex.Module,
 Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.AffineIsometry
```
The only other alternative would be to add `import Mathlib.GroupTheory.OrderOfElement` to `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Span`.

- [x] depends on: #8980

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

I don't particularly mind the new file. But I could also imagine it finding a home in the other new file.

```suggestion
Such endomorphisms are often called reflections of the module `M`. When `M` carries an inner product
```
Is it a conscious design choice that the order of arguments for this lemma will be `x y f`? To me it feels like `x` and `f` belong together, more so than `x` and `y`.
Agreed, I have changed the order.
I guess you can get better defeqs if you explicitly give the inverse function. There might even be an `involutive.toEquiv` or something like that, so that it will still be a one-liner.
Oh, thanks `Function.Involutive.toPerm` is just what I needed.
If you choose the good defeqs above, this will be `rfl`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: definition of reflections and root system uniqueness lemma
